original: ERIKSSON, Erik Sven-Olof, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Kullerstad, Ögl l, 30/10 10 av lantbr K O E o Signe Westling. Studex Norr-kp 29, KTH (V o V) 30—34. Konstr v Byggn.-bol Hallström & Nisses Sundsy 34—35, v AB Skånska Cementgjuteriet Malmö 35, nu arb.ch vid dettas Sthlmsavd. Led Sv Tekn.frn. °ERIKSSON, Erik Valdemar, Ingenjör, öre-bro, f öbr 21/9 87, gm Angda Jacobsson, öbr tekn elem.sk. Ing.elev v ASEA, repr f ASEA i Närke 10, start öbr Elektr Installationsbyrå 10, omb fman t AB 16, vkst dir f detta. En av grund av öbr Rundradio. Ordf i Sv Elektr Entreprenörfrns lokalavd. ERNBERG
translated:
ERIKSSON, Erik Sven-Olof, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, born in Kullerstad, Ögl l, on October 30, 1910, to farmer K O E and Signe Westling. Studied at Norr-kp 29, Royal Institute of Technology (V and V) 30-34. Worked as a construction engineer at Hallström & Nisses Sundsy 34-35, at AB Skånska Cementgjuteriet Malmö 35, and currently employed at their Stockholm branch. Member of the Swedish Technical Association. 

ERIKSSON, Erik Valdemar, Engineer, Örebro, born on September 21, 1887, deceased. Married to Angda Jacobsson, a technical elementary school teacher. Started as a trainee at ASEA, represented ASEA in Närke in 1910, started his own electrical installation company in 1910, became a representative for a manufacturing company in 1916, and was promoted to managing director of that company. One of the founders of the public radio. Chairman of the local branch of the Swedish Electrical Contractors Association. ERNBERG.
